text: Lycée Alexandre Dumas is a senior high school/sixth-form college in Saint- Cloud, Hauts-de-Seine, France, in the Paris metropolitan area. It was previously named Lycée Florent-Schmitt but in 1996 a musical philosophy teacher from the school discovered pamphlets dating from the 1930s in which the namesake, Florent Schmitt, denounced German Jews and Israelite (Jewish) influence on music. Afterward there had been multiple attempts to change the school's name. () ==References== ==External links== * Lycée Alexandre Dumas Category:Lycées in Hauts-de-Seine
title: Lycée Alexandre Dumas (Saint-Cloud)
